content: Using vscode, how do I evaluate the 'main' function in a Lean file (assuming that question makes sense)? E.g. 1/a.leanin advent-of-lean-4.
I get an error message failed to synthesize Lean.Eval (List String â†’ IO UInt32) when I try that.
I don't know how to do it in vscode, but from the command line you can run lean --run 1/a.lean
@Reid Barton Thanks. Do I need to build the project first? I'm getting an error message about no such file a.in.
You need an input file such as the one provided by https://adventofcode.com/2020/day/1
Duh, I hadn't actually read the code.
The List String is a list of command line arguments, which in the editor you could just simulate with #eval main [] (or a non-empty list if the program actually needs some arguments).
